    Using epigraphdb

    usinsg-epigraphdb.Rmd

    Introduction

    library("epigraphdb")
#>   EpiGraphDB v0.2
#>   Please cite: PLACEHOLDER.
#> 
#>   To turn off this message, use
#>   suppressPackageStartupMessages({library("epigraphdb")})

    Queries

    By default, for ease of use, the query returns a data frame (a tibble as per tidyverse convention).

    df <- mr(exposure = "Body mass index",
         outcome = "Coronary heart disease")
#> No encoding supplied: defaulting to UTF-8.
df
#> # A tibble: 1 x 5
#>   exposure        outcome                estimate     se             p
#>   <chr>           <chr>                     <dbl>  <dbl>         <dbl>
#> 1 Body mass index Coronary heart disease    0.450 0.0651 0.00000000117

    Alternatively, you can use results_type = "raw" to get response from EpiGraphDB API.

    response <- mr(exposure = "Body mass index",
               outcome = "Coronary heart disease",
               mode = "raw")
response %>% str()
#> List of 2
#>  $ query  : chr "MATCH (t1:Gwas)-[r:MR]->(t2:Gwas) WHERE t1.trait = \"Body mass index\" AND t2.trait = \"Coronary heart disease\"| __truncated__
#>  $ results:List of 1
#>   ..$ :List of 5
#>   .. ..$ exposure: chr "Body mass index"
#>   .. ..$ outcome : chr "Coronary heart disease"
#>   .. ..$ estimate: num 0.45
#>   .. ..$ se      : num 0.0651
#>   .. ..$ p       : num 1.17e-09

    The query component returns the cypher query that fetches data from the EpiGraphDB neo4j databases. Once you are sufficiently well-versed in cypher you can construct your own refined queries to better suit your needs (forthcoming).

    response$query
#> [1] "MATCH (t1:Gwas)-[r:MR]->(t2:Gwas) WHERE t1.trait = \"Body mass index\" AND t2.trait = \"Coronary heart disease\" AND r.p < 1e-05 RETURN t1.trait AS exposure, t2.trait AS outcome, r.estimate AS estimate, r.se AS se, r.p AS p ORDER BY r.p;"
